Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vase, probably a kantharos; interior: reserved at rim, glazed below; exterior: black band at rim; black-figure decoration consisting of head of Dionysos with open mouth (long hair, added red on beard, ivy wreath with red dots on ivy), to right; inscription on interior.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.19)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 263, no. 38)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 358, no. B461)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 235, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0749) (Phase 1)
